intro: Polyosma velutina, commonly known as the velvetleaf polyosma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and streamside areas. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The species is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
